text: Shadow Minister for Indigenous Australians Linda Burney says "Labor believes in the Uluru statement" and there should be an Indigenous "voice in the constitution, to the parliament". The government announced the next steps to deliver what it calls a 'voice to government' for Indigenous people at the local, state and federal levels but it will not enshrine it within the constitution. "We know Tom Calma and Marcia Langton... will lead the codesign process but who are the other 18?... What do 'local voices' mean?... That's where the lack of clarity lies," Ms Burney said. Indigenous Affairs Minister Ken Wyatt worked to develop an Indigenous voice to parliament to actively play a role in the nation's legislative agenda.
